question: Neap tides are produced in the first and third quarters of the Moon. Which of the following is the situation for Neap tides to occur?
option1: The Moon and the Sun are in conjunction with the other planets
option2: The Moon and the Sun are in opposition with each other
option3: The attractions of the Sun and the Moon are at right angles to each other
option4: The Moon and the Sun are in quadrant position to each other
answer: The attractions of the Sun and the Moon are at right angles to each other
explanation: A tide in which the difference between high and low tide is the least. Neap tides occur twice a month when the Sun and Moon are at right angles to the Earth. When this is the case, their total gravitational pull on the Earth\'s water is weakened because it comes from two different directions. Compare spring tide.
